description: Previously, developers could use Safari's Extension Builder ( Develop → Show Extension Builder ) to create Safari extensions. These extension development projects were saved in folders named .safariextension . After a developer finished creating their extension, they could build the extension into a SAFARIEXTZ file.

SAFARIEXTZ files are Zip-compressed files that contain the HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and media files that comprise an extension. Each file is also digitally signed to verify its developer. To install a SAFARIEXTZ file, users typically placed the file in their [user]/​Library/​Safari/​Extensions directory.
NOTE: Apple introduced Safari extensions in Safari 5.0; the ability to install and develop extensions was enabled by default in Safari 5.0.1 to Safari 12.
